questions.question_text: Which command is used to set the NSX Manager’s logging-level to debug mode for troubleshooting?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct command to set the NSX Manager's logging level to debug mode for troubleshooting is:

C. set service nsx-manager log-level debug

This command will adjust the logging level to debug for NSX Manager, allowing for more detailed logs that can be useful during troubleshooting.

questions.question_text: Which CLI command shows syslog on NSX Manager?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The rules are logged in the Syslog file of the edge node. You can access these logs from the CLI: get log-file syslog In the rule settings, you can also choose the direction and the IP protocol: •
In: The rule only checks traffic to the gateway interface.
• Out: The rule only checks traffic from the gateway interface. •
In-Out: The rule checks traffic from both directions

questions.question_text: Which two BGP configuration parameters can be configured in the VRF Lite gateways? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
C. BGP Neighbors

 You can configure BGP neighbors within the VRF context to establish peering relationships with other BGP routers, allowing the VRF to exchange routing information with other networks.

E. Local AS

 The Local AS (Autonomous System) number is an important parameter when configuring BGP. It defines the AS number that the VRF will use for its local BGP sessions. Each VRF can have a different AS number.
